Returns.description: A dictionary containing project information, or an empty dictionary if the identifier is invalid.

get_project.Docstring:
Retrieve project information based on a given accession identifier.

Parameters:
-----------
identifier : str
              A valid PRIDE identifier (e.g., PRD000001).

Returns:
--------
dict
    Dictionary with project information. Returns an empty dictionary for invalid identifiers.

Examples:
--------
>>> from bioservices import PRIDE
>>> p = PRIDE()
>>> res = p.get_project("PRD000001")
>>> res['title']
'COFRADIC proteome of unstimulated human blood platelets'

Parameters.name: accession
Parameters.description: The accession number to look for.

Parameters.name: pageSize
Parameters.description: How many results to return per page.

Parameters.name: page
Parameters.description: Which page (starting from 0) of the result to return.

Parameters.name: sortConditions
Parameters.description: Fields for sorting, separated by commas (e.g., submission_date,project_title).

Parameters.name: sortDirection
Parameters.description: The sorting order, either ASC or DESC.

Parameters.name: filters
Parameters.description: Criteria to filter the search results in the format field1==value1,field2==value2 (e.g., accession==PRD000001).

Returns.description: A list containing project files meeting the specified criteria.

get_project_files.Docstring:
Retrieve files associated with a specific project.

Parameters:
-----------
accession : str
           The accession number to look for.
pageSize : int
           How many results to return per page.
page : int
           Which page (starting from 0) of the result to return.
sortConditions : str
           Fields for sorting, separated by commas (e.g., submission_date,project_title).
sortDirection : str
           The sorting order, either ASC or DESC.
filters : str
           Criteria to filter the search results in the format field1==value1,field2==value2 (e.g., accession==PRD000001).

Returns:
--------
list
    A list containing project files meeting the specified criteria.

Examples:
--------
>>> p = PRIDE()
>>> results = p.get_project_files(accession="PRD000001", pageSize=10, page=1)
>>> len(results)

Parameters.name: name
Parameters.description: Name of the statistics to retrieve; leave None to fetch all statistics.

Returns.description: A dictionary containing the retrieved statistics information.

get_stats.Docstring:
Retrieve statistics related to PRIDE.

Parameters:
-----------
name : str
       Name of the statistics to retrieve; leave None to fetch all statistics.

Returns:
--------
dict
    A dictionary containing the requested statistics information or all available statistics if name is None.

Examples:
--------
>>> p.get_stats()
>>> p.get_stats("SUBMISSIONS_PER_YEAR")
